channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Fee We're Paying for Stolen Packages
item.description: Retailers are charging a few extra dollars on orders to protect customers against lost and stolen packages.

item.title: Nike CEO Elliott Hill outlines new strategy after retailer blames promotions for declining revenue and profit
item.description: Nike beat Wall Street's expectations on the top and bottom lines under new CEO Elliott Hill.

item.title: AI chipmaker Broadcom shares soar 17% despite mixed quarterly results â€” here's why
item.description: We're increasing our price target on the stock after a slew of positive AI updates.

item.title: Elite Colleges Have a Looming Money Problem
item.description: Trump policies and high costs could make coming years a financial challenge for Harvard and other Ivy League universities.

item.title: The Bank Behind the Fintech Revolution Stumbles After Customer Funds Go Missing
item.description: Evolve Bank at its peak managed around $10 billion for financial technology firms, but it is in turmoil following the collapse of middleman Synapse.

item.title: Micron shares plunge on weak second-quarter guidance
item.description: Micron shares plunged in extended trading after the chipmaker issued weaker-than-expected second-quarter guidance.

item.title: Costco quarter signals record stock run is not done yet. Here's our new price target
item.description: With gross margins and paid memberships trending higher, this rally to fresh highs can continue.

item.title: Darden Restaurants stock climbs as Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse fuel sales growth
item.description: Darden Restaurants met Wall Street's expectations for its fiscal second-quarter results.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Edges Up to 102.37
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index was little changed, edging up 0.04% to 102.37. The index was up in the past 13 trading sessions.

item.title: Jump Trading Raked In Crypto Profits. Now It's Paying a $123 Million Penalty.
item.description: Regulators fine a unit of the high-speed trading firm over its dealings with disgraced crypto tycoon Do Kwon.
